objectives: Students will discuss food and dining out using Expert/Academic register language
Students will engage with Drama themed scenarios related to food and dining out
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of expert level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining food and dining out content with Drama narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore food and dining out through a Drama lens using Expert/Academic language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a dramatic conflict or emotional crisis involving food and dining out

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice expert register vocabulary related to food and dining out in a drama context
Students engage in drama themed role-play about food and dining out using expert register
Students create original drama themed content about food and dining out in expert register

discussion_questions: How would you describe food and dining out in a Drama scenario?
What conflict or tension might be involved in food and dining out?
Can you create a Drama story about food and dining out?
How does food and dining out change when viewed through a Drama perspective?
What expert register expressions would you use to discuss this drama scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Drama situation involving food and dining out
roles: Character A: Using expert register in drama context
Character B: Responding in expert register within drama theme

topic_genre_blend: food and dining out with conflict
food and dining out with tension
food and dining out with struggle

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Expert/Academic throughout: Scholarly, technical, high-level discourse
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Drama theme: Intense emotions, conflicts, life challenges

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Expert/Academic register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Drama themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of expert register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
